snippet: Twenty years after the genocide in Rwanda, the country has become a model for public health, with vaccination rates that are higher than those in the United States.
abstract: Rwanda has shown tremendous gains in public health after 1994 genocide left 800,000 people dead, nation's health system in ruins and diseases like AIDS and tuberculosis rampant.
lead_paragraph: Twenty years after the genocide in Rwanda, the country has become a model for public health, with vaccination rates that are higher than those in the United States.

headline.print_headline: Once a Nation of Death, Now a Symbol of Life
headline.main: Once a Nation of Death, Now a Symbol of Life

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
